text.section:
In this section, "legal proceeding" means:
a civil action for child support;
a paternity proceeding under Title 5, Subtitle 10 of this article; and
a proceeding under Subtitle 3 of this title.

In any support action in which the Administration is providing child support services under federal law, the Administration may initiate a legal proceeding to establish, modify, or enforce a duty of support.

In a legal proceeding, the Administration shall be represented by:
the Attorney General;
the State's Attorney, if the State's Attorney has agreed to provide representation under subsection (g) of this section; or
a qualified lawyer who is appointed by and subject to supervision and removal by the Attorney General.
An attorney who initiates or participates in a legal proceeding under this section shall represent the Administration.

Representation of the Administration by an attorney under this section:
creates an attorney-client relationship between that attorney and the Administration; and
does not create an attorney-client relationship between that attorney and any other person.

The attorney representing the Administration in a legal proceeding under this section shall advise the person whom the Administration has approved for child support services that the attorney's representation of the Administration does not create an attorney-client relationship between the attorney and that person.

section.section: A State's Attorney may make a written agreement with the Secretary of Human Resources and the county to provide legal representation for a fiscal year. An agreement shall be made by September 1 of the year preceding the fiscal year for which representation will be provided.

An agreement shall establish reasonable administrative and fiscal requirements for:
providing and continuing representation; and
reimbursement.
